result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane A Colvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and pays all of his court ordered financial obligations.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

supervisions.notes: 3/29/19.  Days of credit amended from 112 to 113.

superMiscConds.notes: Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with:  Norman Snake or Nick's Pawn Shop.

The defendant shall comply with, and satisfactorily complete, any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  Parties have the revocation summary.  No errors or corrections noted.  Sentencing for Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4, in 14CF205.  Count 1 in 15CF75.  State recommended:  Count 4 in 14CF205, 2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Counts 2 and 3; 9 months jail, concurrent to each other.  Count 4 consecutive to Counts 2 and 3.  15CF75 Count 1;  3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with Count 4 in 14CF205.    Defense recommended:  14CF205 on counts 2 and 3, credit 169 days.  Count 4; 214 days sentence credit.  15CF75, credit for 112 days.  9 months jail each count. 

Court ordered:  Balances as of the date of revocation order $2,441.39 and $518.00.  

14CF205 - Count 4.  2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Credit for 214 days.  
14CF205 - Counts 2 and 3.  9 months jail, concurrent to each other.  Consecutive to Count 4.  Credit for time served.  

15CF75 - Count 1. 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with Count 4 in 14CF205.  Credit for 112 days.

Extended supervision conditions:    The defendant shall comply and satisfatorily complete any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  No contact N.S. or Nick's Pawn Shop.  DNA sample if not already done.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensureate with his treatment needs.  Not to treminate without agent's prior approval.  Judgment for unpaid costs and restitution.  25% of wages to be applied.  

Eligible for CIP & SAP.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.
(routed to Judge after scanning)
Transmittal letter from DOC

FIDR destoyed

Defendant Shane A. Colvin in court with attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Gerald R. Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant currently on supervision. Pleas previously entered on Ct. 2 and 3 of 14CF205. Prosecution moves to revoke diversion agreement regarding Ct. 1 of 14CF205 due to new charges in 15CF75. Prosecution states there is no restitution and victim notification has been complied with. No objection from defense. Court grants motion. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in 15CF75.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing filed with the Court. Court reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing. Prosecution filed Information with the Court. Defense waives reading and files Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. Court reviewed charges/penalties/waiver of rights/elements with defendant. Guilty pleas entered as follows: 14CF205 Ct. 4, reinstated - Guilty plea with Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in; 15CF75 Ct. 1 - Guilty plea with Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Court found the defendant understood the proceedings, pleas are entered and rights waived knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently. Court accepts waiver of rights, his pleas, and finds a factual basis exists and finds the defendant guilty of the charges as plead to. Joint recommendation for 3 years probation. Defendant speaks. Sentence recommendation is adopted and sentence withheld: Probation for 3 years concurrent with following conditions: Defendant must attend and successfully complete a risk & needs assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance. Defendant may apply for expungement if probation successfully completed and all court obligations are satisfied. Must pay the costs of the action including the DNA surcharge and must supply a DNA sample. Defense filed Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. Remaining charges not previously disposed of shall be ordered dismissed but read-in.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on C.M. to appear at 7/22/15 preliminary hearing.
NOH for 7-22 Preliminary hearing / "not deliverable as addressed"
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Deputy C.E. to appear at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing at 07-22-2015 08:45 am
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.  Set for 45 min preliminary hearing.

REPORT FOR BOOKING,  Submit to DNA Sample.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: NS or his family

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the wavier of time limits.  Defendant stated that he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.
